text: Front Country is an American folk pop and progressive bluegrass band founded in 2011 in San Francisco, California. The band consists of lead vocalist and songwriter Melody Walker, mandolinist Adam Roszkiewicz, lead guitarist Jacob Groopman, violinist Leif Karlstrom and bassist Jeremy Darrow. In a special feature on April 5, 2017, NPR's All Things Considered categorized their music as "String-Band Pop"."Get To Know The String-Band Pop Of Nashville’s Front Country", ‘’National Public Radio’’, 5 April 2017. Retrieved on 5 April 2017. == Career == The band was initially formed as a bluegrass ensemble"The Ticket", ‘’The Boston Globe’’, 24 November 2016. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. in 2011 at a monthly jam at the Atlas Cafe in San Francisco’s Mission District with original members Adam Roszkiewicz (mandolin), Leif Karlstrom (violin), Jacob Groopman (guitar), Melody Walker (vocals), Jordan Klein (banjo) and Zach Sharpe (bass). In 2013 they moved on to play a monthly residency at Mission District bar Amnesia."Music: Front Country plays bluegrass at the Green Frog", ‘’The Bellingham Herald’’, 14 September 2015. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. In 2012, the band won first place in the RockyGrass Festival Band Competition,"2013 Music Competitions", ‘’Planet Bluegrass’’, Retrieved on 22 April 2017. and in 2013 they were the winners of the Telluride Bluegrass Festival Band Competition,"Competitions at Telluride 2013", ‘’Bluegrass Today’’, 27 June 2013. Retrieved on 22 April 2017."Front Country Sake of the Sound and Kissin Comes Easy", ‘’Relix’’, 11 December 2015. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. becoming the third band in history to win both contests."True to Your Roots: Front Country Comes to the Great Plains Theatre Friday", ‘’Salina Post’’, 19 April 2017. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. In 2013, songwriter and lead-vocalist Melody Waker won first place in the Chris Austin Song Contest at MerleFest."Martizian wins prestigious songwriting competition", ‘’Martinez News-Gazette’’, 5 May 2013, Retrieved 22 April 2017. She was also named one of "7 Women Smashing the Bluegrass Glass Ceiling" by Paste Magazine."7 Women Smashing The Bluegrass Glass Ceiling", ‘’Paste’’, 9 February 2017. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. Mandolinist Adam Roszkiewicz was nominated for a Grammy in 2013 for his work with the Modern Mandolin Quartet on their album Americana. He is also a member of the Ger Mandolin Orchestra."New York Premiere Performance of The Ger Mandolin Orchestra", ‘’Mandolin Cafe’’, 26 May 2015. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. Following the release of their first full-length album Sake of the Sound in the fall of 2014, the band became a full-time national touring act, hiring bassist Jeremy Darrow in 2015."Jeremy Darrow to Front Country", ‘’Bluegrass Today’’, 31 August 2015. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. In 2014 the band appeared on season 3 of nationally syndicated musical television program Music City Roots"Music City Roots Hosts Front Country, Joe Mullins Wednesday", ‘’CyberGrass’’, 7 October 2014. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. with their appearance airing throughout 2015 and 2016 on PBS affiliates in the United States."Music City Roots Live from the Factory", ‘’Kentucky Educational Television’’, 30 January 2016. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. In 2016, NPR Music named them one of "Nine Artists to Watch For at AmericanaFest"."Nine Artists To Watch For At AmericanaFest 2016", ‘’NPR Music’’, 20 September 2016. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. On April 7, 2017 Front Country released their second full-length album Other Love Songs on Organic Records."Front Country to Organic Records", ‘’Bluegrass Today’’, 12 January 2017. Retrieved on 22 April 2017. The album debuted at #2 on the Billboard Bluegrass Albums Chart."Front Country Chart History", ‘’Billboard’’, Retrieved on 22 April 2017. == Discography == * This is Front Country EP (2013) * Sake of the Sound (2014) * Mixtape EP (2016) * Other Love Songs (2017) == References == == External links == * * * Category:American bluegrass music groups Category:Musical groups from San Francisco Category:2011 establishments in California Category:Musical groups established in 2011
title: Front Country
